reviews.review: Listen, its a great concept for a game! Having a killer run around and trying to kill you and your friends (if you have any *wink wink*). But listen, it seems a little unbalanced and unfair. I mean, you can get downed in one hit and then killed right on the spot. Does that seem fun to you? It doesn't to me! So here is what I suggest. You take away all perks for both killers and survivors. Why? Because then you have the abilities unique to every character! It seems like a simple concept to me but what do I know? I don't play this game as much as others. You know, people who can't find other games in their repertoire. I also spend time outside! Anywho, I will still try to play the game with my friends, because I have friends! And I don't have to queue up as a killer because I don't have any. Not saying that killers don't have friends! I'm just saying: would they if they were playing killer? Keep up the goo- the work developers!

Okay, so i played alot of dead by daylight and then decided to take a break because i played it so much. Here's the issue, when i got back i played maybe like 12 or 13 matches and every fucking match was against someone  clearly better than me or my teammates just decide to leave me. All I'm saying is that i wouldn't recommend the game because of sbmm (skill based matchmaking), the game itself is fun, but not when you can't play the game because you face off against a fucking ultra god.

its a good game if you have an urge to clobber people with a rusty axe or chainsaw, just bare in mind that you need a good pc to run this game, an i5 or higher will do just fine. other than that have fun!

This game has made me question my life. Why am i here? Why are we alive? What is the point of living? Well the answer is, there isn't. Once you start to play this game you get to see the real world, how it works. You see, some people.... some people just want to see the world burn, these people are called MEG MAINS. This game has turned me into an even bigger monster than i ever was, be prepared to turn and never look back, they are watching.
makes me want to cry half the time but i can't stop playing it (help)

This game is fantastic! Very affordable for all of the content, and even without owning every DLC in the game, I feel that I have a fun, engaging experience! There are options for solo players and players that want to have a fun, scary, and intense time with their friends. The game has many options for game play and many challenging factors. The factors of this game succeed at feeling challenging and creative without feeling overwhelming or unnecessary. I can't recommend this game enough! The developers seem very involved and on top of their game and community and I wish them only the best of luck in this project!

Overall it's a good game but please have patience with it. i use to play this game on xbox before pc and i had to take a week to get use to it and now i'm having to do the same on pc. Some people are toxic on here and will make you feel like crap for the person you choose and how you play but you will get use to it and learn a way to play that works for you. Do the tutorials in the beginning so you can understand the game a little better and see if anybody you know plays this game and can help you.
fun game to play with friends

It's super fun overall. Just like every game there are other players who make it not fun sometimes, but still love playing this with my friends as survivor or solo as killer. Definitely takes a little time to get the skills down but very satisfying.

El juego es divertido cuando maduraz y te das cuenta que el campeo, tunneleo y todo eso es algo normal, si eres un buen jugador te esforzaras y sacaras adelante partidas que se ven totalmente perdidas,

Lo √∫nico que realmente me aburre del juego es que cuando ya tienes experiencia un buen killer no te va a dar persecuci√≥n porque se le va la partida y te deja para lo ultimo cuando todo el mapa (pallets) est√©n gastados, entonces en ese tiempo tu que haces? reparar, buscar totems, cajas, ü§Æ lo mas aburrido del juego estar con el dedo en el mouse 1 o 2 minutos esperando que salte una puta skillcheck.

Hay gente muy mala en rangos rojos, uno se pregunta como mierda esa persona subi√≥ si en chase aguantan 5 segundos , eso es gente que solo se la pasa escondido detr√°s de un motores o peor aun que tiran un pallet a la primera y se creen super pros por es tunear al killer eso esta bien para principiantes, todos iniciamos as√≠ pero en rangos altos es una basura y ultra aburrido.

El hecho de que siga jugando y lo califique como positivo es porque aveces tengo partidas super interesantes como survi que es mi rol principal, killers muy buenos que literalmente me destrozan y uno piensa como puedo mejorar, que hice mal en la persecuci√≥n?
Otras partidas muy re√±idas donde lees al killer y sabes en todo momento que es lo que va hacer. ¬°Eso es lo emocionante, ganar  porque sabes que eres mejor que el killer!

Hay que tener en cuenta que el killer siempre va a tener ventaja sobre ti y saber que no se lo hiciste f√°cil, es una satisfacci√≥n personal ya sea si mueres o no,  ¬°Ganar no es solo escapar!

Se cae a pedazos el juego..

The game has awarded me Rank 5 killer (20 being the worst) and at this point I can not even find survivors unless they go out of their way to troll me. Of course that means I'm bad, but why am I rank 5 if I'm bad? Most of this is focused on the killer side of the game because thats what I'm interested in, survivor felt unplayable from the start.
At this point survivors are burning map consumables just to glitch on top of rocks completely out of reach as well. The game stopped being fun around Rank 10 when everyone started using the same 3 perks for trolling. It got better between 8-6 and here I am at 5 giving the game a negative review.

Enough ranting about why I am now giving it a thumbs down after 65 hours.
FOR NEW PLAYERS looking to sink time into this game:
- You can not queue with a party of both Survivors and Killer and have matchmaking fill the empty spots. You have to play a custom game and be down survivor(s) or all play survivor together in a public game.
- The earnable in game currency for unlocking new characters is awarded for account level ups. As you level up the xp required to do so grows so it becomes harder to come by.
- Not all characters are unlockable for free (crossover characters must be payed for out of pocket).
- Each has to be leveled up separately to unlock perks & consumables so you're at a huge disadvantage until level ~30 where you have enough Tier 3 perks and the stronger consumables.
- Very little about actual mechanics are communicated in game so get ready to use the wiki for just about everything.
- As survivors get better, they fail skill tests less (never) which makes a good number of perks useless and greatly speeds up the escape progression when they always get Great results. This is based on reaction time so some people are naturally good while others cant succeed to literally save their life.
- The 3rd person survivor movement feels that it was made for a joystick. Oh here we go: It feels like Roblox without the shift lock.
i love this game awesome game to stream with friends i just don't like ghost face killers

For the first like 50 hours the game is actually kinda fun, but after you pass that point you start to hate everyone who plays this game. 90% of the time you get tunneled to sh*t or you get face/proxy camped. You can basically never have fun. Its like being in an abusive relationship, You have the fun moments but 90% of the time you are suffering. I have had countless days ruined by this shitty game, And I have 500 hours on it. Its like cocaine, you get addicted, but eventually it breaks you
